result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas M. Hebert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
11:07 a.m. Defendant Nicholas M. Hebert in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Defendant Nicholas M. Hebert in custody.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf60 and 14cf252. All parties in receipt of revocation packet. State moves to dismiss to withdraw motion to rescind DPA in 14cf252 and dismiss case in entirety- Granted. Voorhees - Pfeifer/Voorhees statement to sentencing. Voorhees states defendant has pending charge in Lincoln County. Defendant/Court statement on sentencing.
Court sentence
Jail - 7 months
Jail credit - 155 days 
Appeal rights given.
Adj. 11:13 am
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 12, 2017 at 11:00 am.
- includes cover letter and revocation summary
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 13, 2017 at 11:00 am.

1:58 p.m. Attorney John E Voorhees in court.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 14cf252 and 15cf60. Voorhees statement - defendant is in custody in Lincoln County; defendant's probation will be revoked in 15CF60 and he will be returning to Oneida County for that - requests adjournment. Schiek has no objections. Court has not received revocation packet. When 15cf60 is scheduled for revocation hearing, motion in 14cf252 will be addressed. Adj. 2:00 p.m.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter

Defendant Nicholas M. Hebert in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Defendant Nicholas M. Hebert in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
11:46
Calling 14cf252 and 15cf60
15CF160 - State moves to amend to Mis BJ- 946.49(1)(A) - Granted and in 14cf252 - State moves to dismiss counts 1 and 2 and strike the DV enhancer in counts 3 and 4- Granted - DPA filed on counts 3 and 4- Plea questionnaire filed- No contest plea to counts 3 and 4 as stricken and 15cf60 as amended -   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty of BJ and will defer judgment on counts 3 and 4 in 14cf252 and accept the DPA filed 
Schiek/Voorhees/Defendant/Court statement to sentencing on 15cf60
Court WHS and POP for 1 year
CC/CV/Supervision fees/DNA surcharge Submit Sample- to be taken from bond in 14cf252 and remainder forfeited - 38 days credit if revoked   The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Appeal rights given
 in regards to bond in 14cf252 - Court sets $  sig bond -  Review hearing scheduled for November 7, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Includes 15cf60 and 14CF252 - No contact WHATSEVER with T.M.M.

1:27 p.m. Defendant Nicholas M. Hebert in court via video with attorney Corey Mehlos via telephone with leave of court.  Defendant Nicholas M. Hebert in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Mehlos -special appearance today with understanding that he will be retained - Mehlos statement that defendant was in Lincoln County and Mehlos was attempting to arrange voluntary appearance when defendant was arrested on this warrant. Defendant statement to non-appearance in August- mistake on calendar. Defendant provides address of N818 Grantwood Court, Merrill, WI. Non-appearance in October was mistake - thought it was October 12, 2015. Defendant admits to notice of October court date - wrote it down wrong on calendar. Schiek/Defendant/Mehlos statement to bond. Court sets $ bond.  Jury trial scheduled for December 8, 2015 at 08:30 am. Adj. 1:44 p.m.
per Judy @ ONSO - now in custody @ ONSO
per Sara @ ONSO - detainer @ Lincoln Cty
Extradition forecast

8:38 a.m. Defendant Nicholas M. Hebert not in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 14cf242 and 15cf60. Court recites record and notes that jury trial scheduled for August 21, 2015 was rescheduled to allow defendant proper time to obtain counsel and prepare for trial.  Proper notice was sent with notation that defendant needed to call to confirm jury trial. Court states defendant did not call to confirm jury trial - Court called off jury for today's date and Court finds that proper notice was sent to defendant - Based upon non-appearance, Court authorizes warrant for defendant. Adj. 8:42 a.m.
NOH Jury Trial, resent to new address

3pm

Schiek statement - offer not accepted - request 14cf252 be set for jury, 15cf60 will be status - Proposed instruction numbers/special instructions to be sent by 8-14 .  If any MIL - to be filed by 8-7-15
Bail continued  Jury trial scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 08:00 am.

03:00 pm - Defendant Nicholas M. Hebert in court with attorney Patrick Howard Finlan.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 14cf252 and 15cf60.  Finlan states close to a resolution.  In 15cf60 - Finlan in receipt of Information, waives reading and enters not guilty plea.  If not resolved by next date, will set for jury trial.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 14, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

11:16 am - Defendant Nicholas M. Hebert in court with attorney Patrick Howard Finlan.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14cf252 and 15cf60.    Defendant has transportation issues.  Court quashes warrant - not yet issued.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

09:06 am - Attorney Patrick Howard Finlan in court.  Defendant does not appear.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14cf252 and 15cf60.  Finlan states was anticipating a waiver of the prelim in both cases - does not know why defendant is not present - Defendant failed to appear for an office appointment in March.  Court authorizes warrant.
Intra-Circuit Transfer
No contact WHATSOEVER with Tanya M. Manninen

01:19 pm - Defendant Nicholas M. Hebert in court , via video, with attorney Patrick Howard Finlan.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Intra-Circuit Transfer to BR I.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading - set for preliminary hearing .  Michlig/Finlan to bond.  Court sets sig bond.   Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.
